## Libraries

Here are the main codes developed in the team—do not hesitate to get in touch if you want to collaborate on future developments!


### dolfin_warp

A set of [FEniCS](https://fenicsproject.org)- and [VTK](https://vtk.org)-based python tools for Finite Element Digital Image Correlation/Image Registration/Motion Tracking.

- DOI: [https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.8010786](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.8010786)
- GitLab: [https://gitlab.inria.fr/mgenet/dolfin_warp](https://gitlab.inria.fr/mgenet/dolfin_warp)
- PyPI: [https://pypi.org/project/dolfin-warp](https://pypi.org/project/dolfin-warp)
- Tutorials: [https://gitlab.inria.fr/mgenet/dolfin_warp-tutorials](https://gitlab.inria.fr/mgenet/dolfin_warp-tutorials)


### dolfin_mech

A set of [FEniCS](https://fenicsproject.org)-based python tools for Computational Mechanics.

- DOI: [https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.10533833](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.10533833)
- GitLab: [https://gitlab.inria.fr/mgenet/dolfin_mech](https://gitlab.inria.fr/mgenet/dolfin_mech)
- PyPI: [https://pypi.org/project/dolfin-mech](https://pypi.org/project/dolfin-mech)


### NeuROM

The reduced-order modelling code used to create surrogate models based on an hybridization of standard reduced-order modelling methods such as the PGD and deep learning methods.

- DOI: [https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.13772741](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.13772741)
- GitHub: [https://github.com/AlexandreDabySeesaram/NeuROM](https://github.com/AlexandreDabySeesaram/NeuROM)
- PyPI: [https://pypi.org/project/NeuROM-Py](https://pypi.org/project/NeuROM-Py)


## Papers with codes

In order to allow for long term reproducibility of research results, we now try to systematically publish, in addition to the papers themselves, [Jupyter](https://jupyter.org) notebooks with the code to reproduce the figures of the papers, as well as [Docker](https://www.docker.com) images to run the notebooks—in principle you can reproduce the computations directly in your browser thanks to [Binder](https://mybinder.org)!


### [Genet, 2024, C. R. Méca.]

- Title: Finite strain formulation of the discrete equilibrium gap principle: application to mechanically consistent regularization for large motion tracking
- DOI: [https://doi.org/10.5802/crmeca.228](https://doi.org/10.5802/crmeca.228)
- Demos: [https://mgenet.gitlabpages.inria.fr/N-DEG-paper-demos/index.html](https://mgenet.gitlabpages.inria.fr/N-DEG-paper-demos/index.html)


### [Peyraut & Genet, 2025, Biomech. Model. Mecanobiol.]

- Title: A model of mechanical loading of the lungs including gravity and a balancing heterogeneous pleural pressure
- DOI: [https://doi.org/10.1007/s10237-024-01876-w](https://doi.org/10.1007/s10237-024-01876-w)
- Demos: [https://apeyraut.gitlabpages.inria.fr/gravity-modeling-paper-demos](https://apeyraut.gitlabpages.inria.fr/gravity-modeling-paper-demos)


### [Peyraut & Genet, 2025, C. R. Méca.]
